conclusion: Analyze work done by the gas and apply the first law of thermodynamics.
The cycle consists of four processes: two adiabatic and two isochoric.
Processes labeled as: a to b (Isochoric compression), b to c (Adiabatic expansion), c to d (Isochoric expansion), d to a (Adiabatic compression).
Work done in isochoric processes a to b and c to d is zero.
In adiabatic processes, work done is given by change in internal energy.
Net work done in a cyclic process is equal to the area enclosed by the cycle on the P-V diagram.
Area under the curve from b to c minus area under the curve from d to a gives net work done.
Net work done is positive as area above P-V axis is greater than area below.
According to the first law of thermodynamics, Q = ΔU + W.
For a cyclic process, ΔU = 0, so Q = W_net.
Since W_net > 0, Q > 0, meaning more heat is absorbed than released.
The amount of heat absorbed is greater than the amount of heat released during a complete cycle.
